name: Oven-Baked Chicken Wings
author: Derek H
summary: This is my favorite way to eat oven-baked Buffalo chicken wings. Tons of flavor! Serve with blue cheese dressing on the side.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste
2 stalks celery, sliced, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and coat with nonstick cooking spray
Pat chicken wings dry using paper towels
Place flour in a shallow dish and dredge chicken to lightly coat
Place wings on the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until golden and no longer pink in the centers, 40 to 45 minutes
While wings are baking, melt butter over medium heat in a medium saucepan
Add hot sauce, red wine vinegar, Worcestershire, honey, garlic powder, and cayenne
Let sauce simmer on low heat until wings are done baking, about 40 minutes
Remove wings from the oven and place in a large mixing bowl
Pour sauce over wings; toss until evenly coated
